data.title: Leonia Public Library - Local History Collection
data.text: Description Film and T.V. actor as well as writer and director Alan Alda has won the Emmy Award five times, the Writer's Guild Award twice, six Golden Globes and three Director's Guild Awards. He was born in New York City, the son of distinguished actor, Robert Alda. He graduated from Fordham University. After college Alda acted at the Cleveland Playhouse on a Ford Foundation Grant. On his return to New York, he was on Broadway and on television. Alda made his directing debut on MASH. The Aldas lived on Park Avenue in Leonia.
